basics.name: Hilmar Birgir Ólafsson
basics.label: iOS Engineer
basics.summary: A hard working, disciplined iOS engineer with 5 years of experience. I love  Swift, unit testing, fastlane, automation and trying the newest things in iOS. I'm a team player and have experience assembling and leading a team. I've spent the last 4 years building QuizUp and I'm now looking for my next challenge.

work.summary: QuizUp is a trivia game that first came out in November, 2013. Through its lifetime it has gotten over 50 million downloads on iOS and reached #1 in the Apple App Store of 136 countries. I was employee number 6 and after the company started to grow I took on the role of leading our iOS discipline which included 7 developers at its largest. My responsibilities as iOS lead included interviewing, hiring and training employees and leading our overall iOS architecture. Our iOS mantra is test and automate everything. We have over 6000 unit tests that run in under a minute and fully automated pipelines (using fastlane) for testing, distributing test builds and submitting to the App Store. The app is mostly Objective-C but all new code is now written in Swift.

Jónsson & Lemacks is an ad agency in Reykjavík. I was doing full stack web development using Python, Flask / Django for the backend and for the front end I used html/css/javascript with libraries that were popular at the time such as backbone and coffeescript. Clients included local companies such as Landsbankinn, TM, 66 North, Thule, The Grillmarket and many more.

awards.title: Webby Award
awards.summary: Winner of best social game and the people's choice award for best game.

publications.name: Appy Hour
publications.summary: App that shows current happy hours in Reykjavík. Made in collaboration with Reykjavík Grapevine. One of the most popular apps in Iceland for the past years. Nominated for an Nexpó award in 2012. The app is UIKit Objective-C and the backend is Django.

publications.name: Craving
publications.summary: App that gives you a random restaurant recommendation in Reykjavík. Made in collaboration with Reykjavík Grapevine. The app is UIKit Objective-C and the backend is Django.
